Package Algorithms

Class Calculations

  • java.lang.Object
    • Algorithms.Calculations
  • public class Calculations
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the Algorithm to run the game Automatically. The calculations needed for the Algorithm included: Setting up points for each block edge, fruit, and player. Checking paths from player to each fruit with consideration of the blocks. Creating a graph in order to calculate the shortest path from player to fruit using the dijkstra Algorithm.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Calculations

        public Calculations​(Game game,
                    int width,
                    int height)
        The constructor of this class takes the game the board width and height and initiates the parameters needed. Some of the parameters are: LineOfSight, creating the block Objects and the Converter.
        Parameters:
        game - - game object
        width - - board width
        height - - board height

    • Method Detail

      • INIT

        public void INIT()
        This function initiates all the calculations needed to get the shortest path from player to fruit.

      • createBlockObjects

        private void createBlockObjects()
        This function creates GraphObjects from Blocks.

      • createPlayerObject

        private void createPlayerObject()
        This function creates a GraphObject for the player.

        f - - GraphObject

      • createPath

        private void createPath​(GraphObject fruitObject)
        This function creates an ArrayList of GraphObjects containing the player, block edges and a given fruit.
        Parameters:
        fruitObject - - Graph Object

      • addNeighbors

        private void addNeighbors​(java.util.ArrayList<GraphObject> graphObjectArrayList)
        This function takes the GraphObject of the player and edges and calculates each objects neighbors. The calculation is made by using the BFS algorithm.
        Parameters:
        graphObjectArrayList - - graphObjectArrayList

      • createGraph

        private Graph createGraph​(java.util.ArrayList<GraphObject> graphObjectArrayList)
        This function creates a Graph for a given ArrayList of GraphObjects. The Graph is created by creating nodes to each Object that has neighbors and then creating edges between the nodes that have a straight path between them.
        Parameters:
        graphObjectArrayList - - graphObjectArrayList
        Returns:
        Graph graph

      • createPath

        private void createPath​(Graph g)
        This function calculates the path in a given graph from player to fruit, with consideration to the blocks. This method is used by using the dijkstra Graph Algorithm.
        Parameters:
        g - graph

      • getMinPath

        private void getMinPath()
        This function calculates the minimum path for a player from all the paths.

      • createFinalPath

        private void createFinalPath​(java.util.ArrayList<GraphObject> graphObjects,
                             java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> shortestPath,
                             int index)
        This function creates the final path.
        Parameters:
        graphObjects - - graph Object
        shortestPath - - ArrayList containing the path
        index - - index for the minimal fruit

      • clearNeighbors

        private void clearNeighbors​(java.util.ArrayList<GraphObject> graphObjects)
        This function clears the neighbors of each GraphObject after every iteration.
        Parameters:
        graphObjects - - graph object
